intro: Ameroglossum asperifolium, commonly known as the roughleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, blooming in the early morning. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and moist thickets. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
